flaw_data.description: Jerky or rushed shooting motion lacks smooth rhythm
flaw_data.plain_language: Your shot motion is not fluid. Focus on a smooth, rhythmic motion from start to finish.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Work on smooth, continuous motion. No pauses or jerky movements from start to finish.
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Slow motion shooting: Practice entire shooting motion in exaggerated slow motion.

flaw_data.description: Shooting elbow positioned too far from body
flaw_data.plain_language: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Wall shooting drill: Stand arm's length from a wall and practice your shooting motion without hitting the wall.

flaw_data.description: Follow-through timing could be improved for better consistency
flaw_data.plain_language: Your follow-through timing needs work. Hold your form until the ball reaches the rim for consistent backspin.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Hold your follow-through until the ball hits the rim. Think "reach into the cookie jar."
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Follow-through freeze: Hold your follow-through position for 3 seconds after each shot.

detailed_flaws.description: Shooting elbow positioned too far from body
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Wall shooting drill: Stand arm's length from a wall and practice your shooting motion without hitting the wall.

detailed_flaws.description: Guide hand positioned underneath ball instead of on side
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your guide hand is too far under the ball. Keep it on the side for proper support without interference.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Position your guide hand on the side of the ball, not underneath. Think "passenger, not driver."
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Tennis ball drill: Hold a tennis ball with your guide hand on the side while shooting with the other.

detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Follow-through freeze: Hold your follow-through position for 3 seconds after each shot.

feedback_points.discrepancy: Elbow extension at release (82.5°) is outside the ideal range (160-180°).

ideal_range.description: Ideal elbow extension at ball release for optimal arc and accuracy

feedback_points.remedy_tips: Focus on fully extending your elbow towards the basket. Imagine reaching into a cookie jar on a high shelf.
